27, she/her, icon by @sheepskin

summary: Maybe you’re already doing this, but have you tried watching CR at a speed faster than 1. I’ll usually put it at at least 1,25x,...
question: Maybe you’re already doing this, but have you tried watching CR at a speed faster than 1. I’ll usually put it at at least 1,25x, but if nothing too important is happening I’ve watched it at 1,75x. Maybe this way you can make it on time for the 69th
answer: Huh. I haven’t tried that yet, but it sounds like a good idea. I don’t know if it’ll give me enough room this time around though, since I’ve also got some friends and family stuff going on over the next few weeks. Worth a try though, thanks for the suggestion!

reblog.comment: Huh. I haven’t tried that yet, but it sounds like a good idea. I don’t know if it’ll give me enough room this time around though, since I’ve also got some friends and family stuff going on over the next few weeks. Worth a try though, thanks for the suggestion!

summary:
if you think vex didn’t have a short hair period starting on her first birthday without vax, you’re wrong.
if you don’t think...
body:
if you think vex didn’t have a short hair period starting on her first birthday without vax, you’re wrong.

if you don’t think she chopped all her hair off at the shoulder in a fit of distraught rage because she couldn’t braid it right and she couldn’t stand looking in the mirror at her brother’s face as she was getting ready to spend the first of many birthdays celebrating it alone, you’re wrong.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: fisherrend
blog.title: DnD Creations
blog.description: Self-taught creative mind from Sweden. There is nothing I love more than to draw, write and make shit up. Here you will find maps, characters, races, monsters, original characters, fan characters and other bits and pieces made, drawn or written by me. All homebrew content is available for public use; just don't claim it as your own. Please do share though if you use anything I've made, I'd love to showcase your creations!

summary: THE WAR IS COMING. Romera used to be a land of peace, ruled under one beloved King. However, his children have now split the...
caption:
THE WAR IS COMING.

Romera used to be a land of peace, ruled under one beloved King. However, his children have now split the continent and are wreaking harok as they fight amongst themselves. King Rolland II of Hegaehend has always worked as an intermediary for his siblings, attempting to bring peace to his family and the people of Romera, and it matters now more than ever. War is breaking down your way of life, forcing you to step up and take action, and King Rolland has asked anyone of capable skill to protect the commoners, to push back his siblings invading armies from the largest of the populations. Whether you’ve sworn to a deity to protect the people or whether you’re just looking for a good fight there is now a job out there for you. Healer, thieves, knights and spellcasters are all coming together for whatever goal they may have for themselves or the nation, anything to protect what they believe in.

WHAT ARE YOU FIGHTING FOR?

ROMERA-RP is an original medieval fantasy roleplay inspired by Dungeons and Dragons. Using the material and lore, such as races, classes, and deities of 5th Edition, as well as a small mix of homebrew, Pathfinder and 4th Edition. This is an original character bio roleplay catering to players who are 18+. We are hoping to attract dedicated writers who will emmerse themselves in the world of the roleplay, and contribute to character and worldbuilding.

[ CHECK OUT THE FULL ROLEPLAY ]

blog.name: yfere
blog.title: just muddling through
blog.description: Alcin, 22. they/them. Critical Role and assorted nonsense

tags: this is a mess of an answer I'm sorry
summary: meta something i can't get over- it's episode 66 and caduceus is still so- the best i can describe it is "formal" with the m9?...
question: meta something i can't get over- it's episode 66 and caduceus is still so- the best i can describe it is "formal" with the m9? like he still calls them mr fjord and miss beau and when he and fjord have their religious talk in the most recent ep, for example, he says "You have great friends"- he doesn't include himself. not "we" but "you". i dunno maybe im not getting something but it's just weird to me, considering how long he's been with them now, how distant(?) detached(?) *something* he is
answer:
(same cad anon) and yet- sorry to just. throw this at you but its been bugging me for ages and your takes on stuff are always incredible to read- he’s also so weirdly close. like, in the same religious convo, he asks fjord to just “let us take care of you”. so its like. i cant tell if thats just a Caduceus Thing, or if he really hasnt had very many close moments with the group. aaahhh i love this guy but i dont Get him at all anyway i’m done now. :)

This is fascinating stuff, I could talk about it all day. There are a lot of what look like contradictions to Caduceus and how he interacts with people, ways he shows affection and emotion that really don’t resemble how anyone else approaches the group. We can see, for instance, that he very much views his role as that of an adviser and a caretaker–it’s what he’s good at, the type of social script he learned at the Grove, and it’s also what he likes to do. He only began liking his time on the ocean once he started feeling “useful” to the group, like his skills were Helping Them Achieve Something. His primary form of communication after Confusion is Sage Metaphors, and the sheer strength and stubborness with which he holds to his particular ideas about how the universe works and how it is appropriate to act results in him constantly offering somewhat forceful, somewhat parental/coach-like advice to the others. That’s not to say Caduceus thinks of himself as a parent, but his focus seems to be on Helping Them Become Emotionally Stable and Helping Them Reach Their Potential, (while they help him reach his), while at the same time he holds very specific ideas about good ways vs bad ways for them to reach that potential. 

And he cares for them in other ways too–Caduceus, arguably even more so than Caleb and Jester is a compulsive gift-giver, a crafty DIY guy who makes things for the sole purpose of giving them away–fixing a sword for Fjord, making copper door chimes for Caleb, taking a single spare moment in the Barbed Fields to weave a sunhat for Yasha. His projects, even when they’re simple, show a great deal of thoughtfulness and are made for functionality– showing understanding of Fjord’s need to be useful, Caleb’s ever-present anxiety and paranoia, hell, Yasha being pale and likely to burn! He takes gifts that other people have given him, like the tree, and makes it into a communal area for all of them, with spaces for all of their gods. 

So it’s true that he cares about them, but it’s also true that he holds them at a remove. At a time when Caleb and Jester are calling the M9 a family, Caduceus is drawing lines in the sand–in his religious conversation with Fjord, he talks about “his” family, and “Fjord’s” friends. Because Caduceus already has a family, and not one that can be restructured and absorbed into the M9, like Nott’s family and Jester’s mother can. A family that doesn’t actually resemble whatever mess the M9 are to each other. Caduceus keeps to formal address, and while this is a quirk I personally nevereverever want to go away, it shows not only politeness but a reluctance to engage on a familiar level, to acknowledge a personal and enduring attachment.

If I were to speculate, I believe Caduceus is viewing his project and his attachments with the M9 as transitory and somewhat professional in nature. Not in the same way Fjord thinks it’s transitory, in that Fjord refuses to decorate his room and fears either they will pack up and leave or he will be personally booted from the group the second he’s not professionally useful so there’s no use getting comfortable. Caduceus’ version is more that he sees a definite End to the M9′s relationship, and believes they are following a Direction, however meandering, towards that End. Once they have helped each other fulfill their destinies, Caduceus imagines himself going back to the Grove and continuing to do what his family has done for generations, what they are Supposed To Do. Just like how you handle a mourner in the Grove by offering them help and guidance, and keeping a professional distance before sending them off to live their life away from you, it looks like Caduceus is treating the M9 in large part as a collection of mourners he can offer mutual aid before they set themselves free of each other.

The trouble is that the M9 aren’t customers and mourners it’s necessary to keep a professional distance from, they probably wouldn’t want to float out of his life when all is said and done. And Caduceus, who has only ever interacted with The Family He’s Known All His Life and Outsiders/Customers (he didn’t even have a friend like the Traveler) doesn’t yet know how to alter his social scripts to handle these new relationships he is seeing and participating in.

A family that doesn’t actually resemble whatever mess the M9 are to each other. Caduceus keeps to formal address, and while this is a quirk I personally nevereverever want to go away, it shows not only politeness but a reluctance to engage on a familiar level, to acknowledge a personal and enduring attachment.

If I were to speculate, I believe Caduceus is viewing his project and his attachments with the M9 as transitory and somewhat professional in nature. Not in the same way Fjord thinks it’s transitory, in that Fjord refuses to decorate his room and fears either they will pack up and leave or he will be personally booted from the group the second he’s not professionally useful so there’s no use getting comfortable. Caduceus’ version is more that he sees a definite End to the M9′s relationship, and believes they are following a Direction, however meandering, towards that End. Once they have helped each other fulfill their destinies, Caduceus imagines himself going back to the Grove and continuing to do what his family has done for generations, what they are Supposed To Do. Just like how you handle a mourner in the Grove by offering them help and guidance, and keeping a professional distance before sending them off to live their life away from you, it looks like Caduceus is treating the M9 in large part as a collection of mourners he can offer mutual aid before they set themselves free of each other.

The trouble is that the M9 aren’t customers and mourners it’s necessary to keep a professional distance from, they probably wouldn’t want to float out of his life when all is said and done. And Caduceus, who has only ever interacted with The Family He’s Known All His Life and Outsiders/Customers (he didn’t even have a friend like the Traveler) doesn’t yet know how to alter his social scripts to handle these new relationships he is seeing and participating in.

trail.content_raw:
(same cad anon) and yet- sorry to just. throw this at you but its been bugging me for ages and your takes on stuff are always incredible to read- he’s also so weirdly close. like, in the same religious convo, he asks fjord to just “let us take care of you”. so its like. i cant tell if thats just a Caduceus Thing, or if he really hasnt had very many close moments with the group. aaahhh i love this guy but i dont Get him at all anyway i’m done now. :)

This is fascinating stuff, I could talk about it all day. There are a lot of what look like contradictions to Caduceus and how he interacts with people, ways he shows affection and emotion that really don’t resemble how anyone else approaches the group. We can see, for instance, that he very much views his role as that of an adviser and a caretaker–it’s what he’s good at, the type of social script he learned at the Grove, and it’s also what he likes to do. He only began liking his time on the ocean once he started feeling “useful” to the group, like his skills were Helping Them Achieve Something. His primary form of communication after Confusion is Sage Metaphors, and the sheer strength and stubborness with which he holds to his particular ideas about how the universe works and how it is appropriate to act results in him constantly offering somewhat forceful, somewhat parental/coach-like advice to the others. That’s not to say Caduceus thinks of himself as a parent, but his focus seems to be on Helping Them Become Emotionally Stable and Helping Them Reach Their Potential, (while they help him reach his), while at the same time he holds very specific ideas about good ways vs bad ways for them to reach that potential. 

And he cares for them in other ways too–Caduceus, arguably even more so than Caleb and Jester is a compulsive gift-giver, a crafty DIY guy who makes things for the sole purpose of giving them away–fixing a sword for Fjord, making copper door chimes for Caleb, taking a single spare moment in the Barbed Fields to weave a sunhat for Yasha. His projects, even when they’re simple, show a great deal of thoughtfulness and are made for functionality– showing understanding of Fjord’s need to be useful, Caleb’s ever-present anxiety and paranoia, hell, Yasha being pale and likely to burn! He takes gifts that other people have given him, like the tree, and makes it into a communal area for all of them, with spaces for all of their gods. 

So it’s true that he cares about them, but it’s also true that he holds them at a remove. At a time when Caleb and Jester are calling the M9 a family, Caduceus is drawing lines in the sand–in his religious conversation with Fjord, he talks about “his” family, and “Fjord’s” friends. Because Caduceus already has a family, and not one that can be restructured and absorbed into the M9, like Nott’s family and Jester’s mother can. A family that doesn’t actually resemble whatever mess the M9 are to each other. Caduceus keeps to formal address, and while this is a quirk I personally nevereverever want to go away, it shows not only politeness but a reluctance to engage on a familiar level, to acknowledge a personal and enduring attachment.

If I were to speculate, I believe Caduceus is viewing his project and his attachments with the M9 as transitory and somewhat professional in nature. Not in the same way Fjord thinks it’s transitory, in that Fjord refuses to decorate his room and fears either they will pack up and leave or he will be personally booted from the group the second he’s not professionally useful so there’s no use getting comfortable. Caduceus’ version is more that he sees a definite End to the M9′s relationship, and believes they are following a Direction, however meandering, towards that End. Once they have helped each other fulfill their destinies, Caduceus imagines himself going back to the Grove and continuing to do what his family has done for generations, what they are Supposed To Do. Just like how you handle a mourner in the Grove by offering them help and guidance, and keeping a professional distance before sending them off to live their life away from you, it looks like Caduceus is treating the M9 in large part as a collection of mourners he can offer mutual aid before they set themselves free of each other.

The trouble is that the M9 aren’t customers and mourners it’s necessary to keep a professional distance from, they probably wouldn’t want to float out of his life when all is said and done. And Caduceus, who has only ever interacted with The Family He’s Known All His Life and Outsiders/Customers (he didn’t even have a friend like the Traveler) doesn’t yet know how to alter his social scripts to handle these new relationships he is seeing and participating in.

summary: Hi :) What episode of critical role are you on and who are your favorite characters so far? (I'm in the middle of ep 12 and I...
question: Hi :) What episode of critical role are you on and who are your favorite characters so far? (I'm in the middle of ep 12 and I like yasha, not, and caleb)
answer:
I’m in the middle of ep 5 so far! But I don’t mind seeing spoilers.

And I absolutely LOVE beau. Her “fuck it!” attitude and humor even in battle is just 😩👌. I also really like jester and yasha. But idk much about yasha yet!

summary: “there’s kind of an ominous sense here” matt says, about the underground room that is preceded by an obelisk with “eat every...
body:
“there’s kind of an ominous sense here” matt says, about the underground room that is preceded by an obelisk with “eat every heart” written on it in abyssal, with doors decorated with statues of celestials weeping blood, containing not only the skeletons of celestials but more, bigger, musical statues that are also weeping blood, and all of them are facing an onyx black underground tower wall with very big scratches on it.

yeah. feeling a little ominous.

blog.name: flapjacques
blog.title: A Member of the FlapJack 5
blog.description:
Good friend for Jesus sake forbear,
To dig the dust enclosed here.
Blessed be the man that spares these stones,
And cursed be he that moves my bones.
